3.description: As far as speed is concerned, this place is a disaster. They're ALWAYS under staffed any time I visit which results in extremely slow lines. Sometimes you have to wait 20 minutes for your food, and the employees always seem to have an attitude. On the bright side, the fries and the food are always fresh, and they accept coupons that come in those little Burger King booklets, which is a plus.

1.description: This Burger King is rude and lack any customer service.  They got the order wrong and when I returned all hell broke loose. They took the good back and refused me my money. And attempted to call the police on me. We waited 2 hours and all this time they lost thousand of dollars over a twenty dollars order.

2.description: HORRIBLE experience.  Closes before midnight, even though the drive-thru menu board advertises "Open til Midnight or later", which I won't take away points for, because that could mean at participating locations only.  So I didn't get to order anything on my first visit, however, my second visit I made sure to go during early evening hours, was asked to wait a few seconds to place my order by the drive thru cashier, waited at least five minutes to place an order, confirm the order, and be given my total.  Waited another five minutes to receive my food.  NEVER visiting this place again.

5.description: Went for the New Frappe cashier said they don't have the machine but the commercial advertising it has been airing for 3 weeks. Get it together people!!!!!

0.description: It's Burger King, not haute cuisine. Keeping that in mind, however..this place could stand for some help.Staff is so-so, the garbage inside and out can be a bit off-putting, even though I've never caught any whiffs of anything, but I'd definitely be on staff about dumping the cans, inside and out of this place more often than they do if I managed this place. I disagree with Baroness D. that the employees only show favor to people with no class. It's all about your attitude with them. If you walk in with your nose up, as if you are judging them, then they have a problem. It's not right, it's not fair, but it's been my observation, as while the service ain't the best, I've never been treated rudely or suffered any rudeness from them. Truthfully, I've never been to the bathroom here, as the garbage teeming in the cans pretty much told me to stay away. But, like my star rating says, I've experienced better.

4.description: I dread coming to this place for many reasons, but it is the closest fast-food restaurant to me, so I really don't have any other choice. Let me give a rundown of the reasons why I dread coming here:1. hypes hanging out inside and around this place2. horrible customer service3. employees have too much of a nasty attitude, and only show favoritism to customers who aren't like me (the customers they favor being those who have absolutely no class or nothing going on in their lives)4. restrooms aren't adequately stocked with toilet paper because the stupid, broke, lazy hypes steal it!5. not too fond of BK anyway, because many of the sandwiches and other staples they have are only for a limited time unlike McDonald's, White Castle, or Arby's, who keep their new additions permanently it seems.

3.description: Man I love this place the salads , jerk, meat not jus chicken but fish also is scrumptious , good customer service, friendly people and u get what you pay for!!!

1.description: I read the reviews and headed south to this place. We ordered Jerk Chicken and Jerk Catfish with a side of Mac and cheese. Everything was dried out. The Mac and cheese was overcooked, dry and like a cake square. ODD.  I tried ... 2 stars because the staff was nice and the facility was clean.

2.description: This is my new go to spot, the food is fresh and tasty. The staff is very friendly which is hard to find on the southsideof Chicago. Great customer service, its awesome when the staff hands you your food and says "Thanks for coming in"  Please try the Mac Cheese you will not be disappointed, someone's grandma is in the back baking this tray of cheesy blessing. I usually call ahead and the ETA are always  beyond reasonable.

5.description: I got the jerk catfish. It did not taste or look like jerk catfish. The fish, cabbage, rice and beans were so nasty. I think the food had been cooked a while ago. They also did not have any seasoning on the food. I took three bites and threw the rest away. Not worth your money.

6.description: The best jerk and American food in the mid west. Representing New York, Chicago, and Jamaica... Management is very professional and courteous.. Love it all a must try...

0.description: Definitely will be my must go to spot when visiting Chicago. Fast service and delicious food huge portions definitely get your money worth.

4.description: I pass by this establishment every day heading westbound so I decided yesterday I wanted to try them.  Plus I had a taste for jerk chicken.  I reviewed the reviews on here and it seemed like a place to order from.  I wanted to review the menu before I called to place my order but I couldn't find one so I called and took my chances.  I spoke with a nice lady who explained what comes with the jerk chicken dinner and gave me a few meat options(white, dark or mixed).  She told me 10  minutes.  I arrived 25 minutes later.  The place is small, no place to eat in, limited parking.  Inside it was clean as well as the outside.  It's located in Englewood, near the corner of 55th & Halsted.  A rough neighborhood, but this gem is worth the visit.  Courteous service, neatly packaged.  Reasonable prices.  The food was delish.  The chicken was spicy already without the sauce.  The sauce was heavenly.  Mac & cheese tasted like my mother's(RIP mom).  The cabbage was multi colored with carrots mixed in there, loved it too.  The rice and beans had a sweet-like taste to it.  They also gave a slice of the Jamaican bread.  It was $10 and worth each bite.  I had 4 pieces of chicken there, I ordered the mixed chicken.  Leftovers for the next day.  U will not be disappointed.  I'm glad there's a jerk chicken place on the way home.  I support the independent businesses.  They will see me again soon.  Phone first so your order will be ready.  A couple of folks asked me how did I get my order so fast.  Lol.  Bon apetit.

14.description: Posters not cutting it anymore...tired of hanging things with scotch tape...time to get your self  "Framed "as in artwork for a more grown up look in your home.  This tiny frame shop will lavish some attention on your photos or artwork  or whatever you have to hang or showoff and custom build a lovely frame without bankrupting your wallet and people will be amazed at your good taste or at least admire the frame.

3.description: I'm in love with the work that Richie and his wife Marsha have done for me- Framed All of my favorite photos of my Son. Using some awesome wood that I never even knew existed. I explained the style I was looking for and they hit it spot on! I can't help but to keep coming back! Great prices. Great timing. Great conversation. Great work! They've also done some work for my mom although her framing style is way different from what I like-  they did a beautiful job! Highly recommend this Bucktown Gem!  Yay for local businesses

1.description: Marsha was great to work with. After calling many local places to have a panoramic skyline pic we took from our boat frames with no mat but instead a glass edge to show through to our exposed brick; they hit the nail on the head. The frame looks great, they did a wonderful job and they were willing to negotiate on the price after telling them what some other shops has quoted. I am taking a diploma back today after going over mats and frames. Their selection is great and they are very knowledgeable.

2.description: I gave this review 5 stars because of the high quality, thoughtful attention to detail, and the overall experience of purchasing frames at this small business, established in the Bucktown neighborhood over twenty years ago and run by Marsha and Richie Pardo.  Both have artistic talent to match color and style to the work.Many picture frame stores will try and oversell you, but Webster Street Picture Frame Co. is an honest framer.

9.description: I will definitely go back here.  The man (I think his name was Richie) was very friendly, and the job was done in less time than promised and for cheaper than I expected.  I was surprised by how many framing shops were in the neighborhood when I moved here, and feel as though I lucked out picking this one.

10.description: Wonderful experience. Marsha, the owner, was pleasant and knowledgable. Great selection, AMAZING prices, and I love giving business to a local, family-owned business. My order was ready when promised. Will definitely be back for my next framing project!!

4.description: Just met with the ladies at Webster Street Picture Frame and we had a great time picking out matts and frames for a design project we are working on.  They were friendly, fun and kept our budget in mind when selecting frames.  Excellent service and great location!

16.description: I had a very good experience with this frame shop.  I brought in some fine art prints that I wanted archival framing for.  They gave me a very thoughtful consultation about various options.  Not only were they alot less expensive than the bigger shops - I felt they have my works more personal attention.  I was very happy with the finished products and I've been back as a result.  I feel better about their experience and personal attention versus other frame shops where inexperienced low paid college kids end up working on my stuff.

6.description: I called around to get quotes from three different frame shops and Marsha from Webster Street Picture Frame gave me the best quote for a golf putter I wanted to get framed in a shadow box for a gift.  Webster Street Picture Frame was super easy to work with and did a great job on the shadow box.  I'll definitely go back next time I need something framed!

11.description: I highly recommend going here for all of your framing needs. I know I will. Over the past few years a dozen or so frame shops opened up in the bucktown/wicker park area but this one stands apart from the others. It's a charming, no-frills, neighborhood storefront that is owner operated. Great service, quality work and good prices.

12.description: I will never recommend this frame shop to anyone. The job was not done in a timely matter. They would keep telling us that it would be ready the next day and waste our time when we'd try to pick it up because it wasn't even touched yet. Finally, the artwork we brought in was returned to us damaged. When we asked about the damages they were very angry and yelled at us to get out! Yes, they kicked us out!! We were accused of coming into their shop with the intent to argue with them. Ridiculous.There are plenty of other frame shops out there that I believe deserve your business more.

5.description: We went here because my husband lived around the corner for MANY years and we saw it on Yelp.  We had the most fantastic experience and we would highly recommend them.  The owners do everything there and they were able to give us many options and had a quick turn around on our 2 items.  They were very reasonably priced fort he work that they did and we will definitely be going back!!

13.description: If I could give this place negative stars, I would.  I found this to be such an unpleasant experience and felt that they were a shady business.I brought in delicate artwork that already had been framed, except that the glass had shattered during transportation to see if it was something that they could take care of.  They said that they were happy to look into it and give a try if possible.  I also brought in a poster to be framed.  They said, it'll be ready within a week and we'll give a call.A week and a half went by and no phone call.  No biggie.  I called and they said that they will work on it tonight, and to pick it up the next day.  But when I arrived for pick up, it still hadn't even been touched yet, to which they were apologetic and said they would definitely have it the next day.  Again, no biggie.  Here's where they really went down as the worst business I have ever personally encountered in my life.  When my husband and I came back yet again, the framed poster looked good, but they apologized that there was nothing they could not add glass into the already framed artwork.  Which was fine with me.  Until I opened it and looked inside...the once intact frames were falling apart at one corner, and there were sharp chips and cuts in different areas of the frame.  While paying for the poster, I casually asked about the damaged frame.  To my shock, the woman started getting accusatory and angry!  She said that we had obviously come in there to argue and that she would put up with no such thing.  Within a minute of trying to explain that we surely were not there to argue and was just asking about the damages (to which she of course said it was that way when i brought it in), she told us to get out of her store.  What was even more infuriating was that we were just saying just to forget about the frame and that we were leaving and never coming back, and she had to make it a point to stand by the open door and yell at us to leave.  Wow!!  I have never been kicked out of any place before...so this was definitely new to me. I would NEVER NEVER NEVER recommend this place to anyone!

7.description: I had 3 odd-sized Star Wars prints (shut it! I'm a fan. LOL) that I wanted to frame.First I went to Accentric. Nice enough. But, although, I'm a Star Wars fan I was not about to pay over $1000 for three frames. I went to Webster, next, because my sister gave me a coupon for 20% discount from there and it was only two blocks away. Marsha was very nice and helpful. I am pretty sure I didn't get 20% off frames because Marsha kept rounding down on stuff! So I'm sure my total was discounted more than 20%. LOL! My total for three frames at Webster was only about $100 more than ONE frame from Accentric.  The frames are made on-site too (in the back of the store)! If you ask Richie he'll show you his shop--very cool.One of the frames was cracked and they redid the frame in two days.Good people.

8.description: What a Bucktown neighborhood gem! When my boyfriend and I wanted to redecorate our apartment, we dug up some "lost" treasures that needed framing. Naive to the world of interior decorating and completely alien to the art of framing, I painstakingly searched every area super store, craft store, home store in search of cheap, ready made frames for my irregularly shaped pieces. Alas, I resigned myself to forking over extra money for custom framing - but where to go? After receiving a flyer on my door - mind you never once until then were any of the hundreds of flyers placed on my door relevant to me - I decided to take a peaceful stroll around the corner to visit the custom frame shop I passed hundreds of times before over the years. Always supporting the local businesses in the neighborhood (especially the bars), I decided to give them a try. The OPEN sign invited me to approach the garden unit, the faded sign at the door told me to ring the bell. I was pleasantly greeted by a friendly gentlemen whose name escapes me. He walked me through an informative consultation, laid out my options and price, And put my mind at ease and ale intendant anxiety I had about custom framing. As I walked out, I felt like a real adult - you know, that feeling you get when you buy your first mattress or sign your very first car loan. I truly entered the stage into adulthood of my late twenties. This will be my first stop next time I need someone framed. In fact, I can't wait to need something framed. Until then, I have two beautiful pieces of framed art on my wall because of Webster Street Framing.

0.description: While a very fancy piece, could be out of their league, this friendly neighborhood shop can quickly do a quality job on your favorite poster or wedding photos. They have a decent selection of frames and best prices in town. I brought in two professional group photos from a company trip to hang in my office wall. The gentleman who helped me was great. He helped me select a frame, took my order and turned it around in just a few days. I am trilled with the results. Because they are tiny, they may not offer the selection, nor the sophistication required to frame some collectible artwork but for everyday life 0 there is no place better:)

15.description: This place is great. The owner is down to earth and easy to talk to. She is knowledgeable about frames and gives you the time of day. Definitely not a rush through experience. Best of all, it's a small local business-I would rather give my money to them.

3.description: I love the beef and shrimp fried rice the beef is so tender. The delivery is fast and I love that they are in paypal I can pay for my order easy.

1.description: First off this was my first visit... I so wanted to love on this place. The lady at the counter was nice i ordered seafood lo mein with broccoli and shrooms, small shrimp egg foo yung and egg roll...i patiently wait then she tells me food is ready...get bag(wondered why it was so heavy) but i know they package everything seperate...get home...yup wrong order i call and she tells me to bring it back. Im sort of upset but when i get there she smiles cause she's bagging up rice and i say is my food still hot and she smiled and gave me food. Mow taste...has good flavor but i dont care for brown sauce and noodles a bit sweet...i have had better but its worth a try!

2.description: Ordered dinner, driver stated he called however we never received a call. Manager stated she would send the order back in two hours. Seriously!  Very rude and tacky.

0.description: Awesome chinese food! I could give this place 5 stars on the beef fried rice and smoothies alone.. The smoothies are $3 and are huge with a wide variety of flavors and they even let you combine two for your smoothie without charging you extra.The sweet and sour chicken is decent, but the actual chicken inside of the batter was dry, so 3.5 stars for that.\This place is definitely worth a shot if you're in the area and looking for good chinese food.

4.description: Love this Chinese food! It's not terribly expensive and it's full of flavor...I am a loyal customer !!!

0.description: Well, we had to get off the freeway for some gas - just could not make it back with what we had.  I heard a lot about the south side so we were a but skeptical.  Inside this gas station was a Hook Fish and Chicken. I was tired, grumpy and most importantly, hungry.  I love fish n chips so I decided to take a chance, even though my comrades were heckling me every step of the way.The menu is simple: fried fish and chicken.  The guy who helped me was super nice and friendly.  I was also taken aback.  He made conversation while I waited and was just, well, cool.The food was typical.  Great tasting (what fried food isn't!)  No problems the next day (if you know what I mean).  I would certainly return again.  Just shows that you cannot judge a fish by the gas station its in!

58.description: Pearl's Nails just got a new customer. I have tried out a couple places and always left disappointed but the service at Pearl's was great and I got what I wanted. They also have amazing offers that add more value to what you are getting. Definitely going back and highly recommend this place. I like the space and setting too and great place to bring your gf along for company!

56.description: The staff is here is very friendly. Large collection of colors. Had an appointment and was seen right away!

29.description: Pearl's is great. I love any place with hot stone massage. I've come here for the last two years for the birthday discount ($21 pedicure). I realized I didn't have cash for a tip, but she just swiped my card a second time to charge the tip.

42.description: This place is a joke! I was around the area with my bf and we decided to stop by this nail salon for my pedicure and eyebrow waxing. Before I start, I have to admit that one of the good things about this place is that they open on Sundays and I know not a lot of nail salons do. Anyway, I called beforehand for an appointment so I did not have to wait for long. I walked in and the lady directed me to the pedicure chair. First of all, I told her the massage chair was not operating correctly. Instead of trying to fix the situation, she brushed it off her shoulders and said it was probably broken. Second, she did not make the effort to cut my cuticles. The pedicure itself did not even last for 15 minutes. It felt like something I can do myself at home. After my pedicure, she told me to go this room for my eyebrows and then again, I was disappointed. The eyebrow waxing itself was a bigger joke than the pedicure. I told her I wanted a clean up for my eyebrows. She did five strips of waxing and DID NOT HELP ME SHAPE MY BROWS. She didn't tweeze the excess part of my brows. She didn't even help me trim it at all. Literally, 5 strips of waxing and told me I was done. I ended up trimming it and fixing it myself at home. I would've told her to fix it but that lady did not look like she knows what she was doing and I am not putting my eyebrows at risk and let her make it even worse than it already is. My boyfriend had a foot massage while he waits for me. He was not satisfied as well. The lady who massaged him did not put any strength/effort to his massage. He did not felt any pressure from her at all. I would not recommend this place to anyone. I was not impressed with my overall experience. It wasn't crazy expensive for my service but this place was super unprofessional and I can't believe I paid someone for a half-assed job. I am never coming back.

23.description: Service was great! They take them time to polish and ensure it is done correctly. The salon is clean and everyone is friendly. I am extremely particular and I thought they did an excellent job. The massages are great also!

47.description: Holy hell this place is amazing. Leg scrubs, neck massages, hot stones. Will definitely be coming back. Regularly.

8.description: I took my 5 year old daughter with me for a pedicure and they were so accommodating and helpful. They helped her find the sparkling colors she loved and made sure that she was comfortable. We both received great pedicures with awesome customer service!

31.description: Do NOT go here. I'd been here a few times for an eyebrow shaping (eyebrow wax), and they did excellent work, but I went there yesterday, and I noticed my skin was more sensitive than usual. I didn't realize it until I got home and got to take a closer look that the woman had ripped some of the skin from my eyelid off! This just shows carelessness on Pearl's part. I will never go here again.

34.description: Fantastic experience!  Best pedi I have had in years.  Carol was really attentive to detail and had such a caring touch.  Will definitely come back, especially with friends.

16.description: I went here spontaneously after eating breakfast with a couple of friends. Nice atmosphere & friendly staff. They offer free beverages and warm neck braces. They give great service. I will be back the next time I'm in the area.

13.description: So-so mani/pedi yesterday. Was a little rushed--despite no wait on a Saturday morning--and polish looks...okay. A few chips already--expect more than 24 hours before that starts! What was odd to me was when she ran my credit card for the $40 charge--asked if I wanted to put a tip on the card, and I said yes. Brought the charge slip back to sign and it was for $50. I asked why, and she said, "Oh, you said put a $10 tip on the card." Um, no, I did not say to add a 25% tip for mediocre service. Would have tipped 20% anyhow and wasn't going to argue over a couple bucks, but that left a weird taste in my mouth. Not going back.

11.description: They fit me in today no problem and the pedicure alone has been great! I feel pampered and relaxed already with my ma manicure still to go!

39.description: Went here this morning with two girl friends - employees were friendly, quick, and made for an enjoyable experience. We got the weekday special with the mani-pedi combo and all three of us are happy with the visit

37.description: I love this place! I've been coming here for a few yes now with my daughter.  Everyone is always really nice. Lots of brands and colors to choose from. Plus u get a drink that is refillable with your mani/pedi and a quick but nice shoulder massage while you wait for you hands/feet to dry.

0.description: My husband wanted to get a manicure after working on his car for the past week. He decided to go for the mani-pedi package, and while I was waiting, he convinced me to get a manicure...something I'd never done before.I was a little worried when Kim started coming at my fingers with all the pointy and clippy tools at her disposal, but she was an expert, and I quickly relaxed with the heated neck pillow. All turned out well, and I felt very pampered with the care she took. Free sodas and hot tea too!My husband was still in the middle of his pedicure once I was done, so since there's no real waiting area, they put me in one of the massage/pedi chairs, turned it on, and left me there to chill while I waited. Nice finishing touch!As a guy, a manicure's not something that I'd probably do a lot, but if I'm ever in the area and my hands are looking a little scraggly, I'd easily drop in again. Maybe next time I'll even try a pedicure.

38.description: Very disappointed. My nails were done in 15 min. I got a no chip on Thursday and by Saturday they were ruined. Very sloppy job.

51.description: Loved my mani/pedi from Pearls Nails.  They were very accommodating for my party of 4.  If I'm in the neighborhood again, I'll go back.

27.description: I love this place! They offer a selection of free drinks, awesome massages and a great $35 mani pedi deal Monday through Wednesday. Very clean and very friendly. The perfect way to pamper yourself!

32.description: In the beg. I wrote a really good review because i wanted to get the discount that they were offering. However, I realized that they forgot a big part of the pedicure and I wasnt satisfied with that.. make sure you get the entire pedi because it seems that they rush through this process.

54.description: I highly recommend this salon. Myra is the best! It's a treat to come here and get pampered. Free drinks are a plus, there are great discounts, and my no chip looks great.

48.description: My wife brought me here to get my nails cleaned. Outstanding service. They were very nice and attended us right away. Great prices and complimentary drink

44.description: I absolutely love this place. They really take care of you. The hot stones for their pedicure is the absolute best. They have a variety of colors to choose from, all nice brands, and their staff is so friendly. Will keep coming back!

24.description: They did an amazing hot stone massage during my pedicure and we're super sweet about pushing back our appointment when we were running late. The manicure massage was so perfect to relax my hands and she even gave me a shoulder massage!

7.description: I love this nail salon! I live or work anywhere near it but alway make sure I go to Pearl's Nails because the service is amazing. Got a pedi and a no chip mani today. Got there a little earlier than my appointment and they took me early. The highlights were the pedi massage chairs, the leg stone massage and the shoulder rub during my mani.

49.description: Everyone who works here is super nice and friendly. Never have I had a better massage during a pedicure --- complete relaxation! And it's byob, bonus!

40.description: The spa pedi and no chip is amazing. Def my go to place! Service is organized and excellent!!

53.description: We came here to get our nails done for a friend's wedding. They were great! Lots of color choices and great service!

30.description: Easy to get to location and great service. Can't beat the massages in the mani pedi package, which is $35 on weekdays.

46.description: This place is my absolute favorite! I was fortunate enough to find them when I first moved here and lived close by. I tried a couple other places closer by when I had to relocate and immediately went back to Pearl nails. They do a wonderful job and the staff is friendly. Cici is the best and does such a great job on the no-chip manicure. I highly recommend this place. FYI, make an appointment. Walk-in's usually have to wait awhile.

1.description: Chicagoans - this is the place to go to get your nails done. I can only speak for the no-chip manicures, but out of the many no-chips that I have gotten in Chicago, Pearl's does the best. I am currently two weeks into a no-chip from Pearl's, and my nails still look perfectly polished. The service is great as well. The manicurists are efficient with the manicures, yet you still walk out feeling pampered. They have many week-day deals, and are willing to take walk-ins and day-of appointments.UPDATE: This no-chip manicure lasted 4 weeks! FOUR WEEKS! I will not be going anywhere else to get my nails done.

55.description: I went on a Tuesday and got a regular mani and pedi for $35. The mani didn't chip until Saturday! That has never happened with regular nail polish. The technician was great too! The only complaint was that it was dirty.

9.description: Bought a Groupon for the spa pedicure and it was awesome! They have free drinks while you get serviced and tons of colors to choose from. The pedicure came with a sugar scrub and hot stones which I love! I will definitely be coming back to this salon!

26.description: Well I've been there a few times and it's really cute in there. The service is descent except that the pedicures are kind of generic. I mean like when I get them they I normally feel really clean afterwards but here it just feels like there's oil on my feet.

25.description: I'm going to be all the way honest with you. The reason this place has so many good reviews is because they offer a discount when you do so. My girlfriend and I set up impromptu appointments for manis and pedis with them today at 3pm. We got there on time but weren't ween until about 3:20. Mira, a nail tech there, did apologize for us having to wait. We both say in the pedi booths, and while my polish is decent, my feet still have a lot of dry skin on them because they use those sponge sort of foot smothers in comparison to pumice or a metal type of skin slough-er. Otherwise decent job.Got a shellac no-chip and the color is beautiful and the paint job is okay. Maybe I'm picky about my nails, but I like the polish to cover my entire nail, including the clear polish. My nails were filed a bit uneven but overall not bad. While my nail job wasn't the best, I still tipped Mira we'll win

12.description: Nice and clean place, ice cold diet cokes on tap, good magazine selections....and the promise of a discount for a positive yelp review. Hm, what's missing in that? The service here is good but my main thing is quality of the paint job is what I'm in for, and I don't think it's unreasonable to expect a no chip manicure to last more than 4 days, but that's about what you get here. Don't be fooled by the positive reviews, just ladies looking for a discount. Lots of other nail places in the area to check out with better service and quality results. Sorry Pearls but I think we're done!

59.description: This has been my fourth or fifth time here since moving to the area. Each time I am very happy with the service and how my nails look! Everyone is very accommodating-- one time I came close to closing time and they were able to do both my no-chip mani and pedi simultaneously. Excellent customer service and consistently solid results with my bi-monthly no chip manicure. Make sure to bring cash!

21.description: I'm here right now. The young lady doing my pedi is very sweet and was good w/ the massage and is obviously trying to do a good job but her hands are shaking VERY visibly and her tools look dirty, her whole cart does, & the mani station is also really dirty.. The guy working beside her is saying sexually allusive inappropriate things to his client and my nails are not the greatest. No communication from my nail tech-she seemed upset-shaking like mid-earthquake. Had to have her redo some of the mani it looked so sloppy. The male tech's questioning and comments to his client were gross....asked her eye color and she said one color, then added they change color by her mood, so he gets all weird and says,"Ok, when you're at home, naked, looking at yourself in the mirror, what color are they then? He also asked if she was a "real ginger"(GROSS PEOPLE) and started discussing someone's "ginger fetish) ie men who obsess over f**king redheads.....it was making her & I both very uncomfortable. Wanted to make this my new nail salon but you couldn't pay me to go back, esp w/ the cleanliness issue!!!

17.description: I was able to get a manicure/pedicure as a walk-in right away which was great. It was affordable (40 dollars) wish I would've gone for the spa treatment at 60 dollars, but the technician didn't ask and he had already started so I didn't say anything. They offer some complimentary beverages which is a nice touch and a shoulder/neck rub while your nails are drying. I give it 3 stars because my big toe was smudged (which I didn't notice until I was gone) and my cuticles on my fingers were cut a little too low and bled a little/were inflamed.

10.description: After a great hard workout I was craving a great pedicure to top off my day so I went to pearl's nail salon. As I walked in they seemed very busy but told me it would only take 10 minutes for my boyfriend and I. It took 10 minutes exactly to get in a chair and soak in nice hot water. She ended my day when she gave me the best leg massage on earth. Almost fell asleep. I may add when you give a full review you do receive a discount but they for sure deserve a review because they always seem to amaze me! Have not had a bad experience since I have been coming here for a year now.

5.description: I have been here twice and plan on coming back a lot more. I've been very happy with both manicures. Efficient, friendly staff. Clean environment. Good selection of polish and prices are fair. You also get a neck warmer and shoulder massage which is a nice bonus. Highly recommend!

3.description: I had a great experience at Pearl Nails. The staff was very kind and the service was great!! I would certainly come back, because they did a great job on my mani & pedi.

35.description: I went to Pearls Nails for a mani pedi when I was visiting Chicago on a friends recommendation. They offered more services and perks than any other nail salon I've been to! A regular pedicure has hot stones and a scrub. They have TVs and will play E! or the Food Network, I don't watch tv that much so it was nice to relax and watch something I am interested in. Also they give you free beverages like sparkling water, soda, juice. Lots of color selections. For mani I got a gel color and it looks great. I would recommend this place to anyone living or traveling in Chicago.

19.description: My second time here treating my wife to a pedicure and I get sucked in every time to get a pedicure with her. This place makes men feel comfortable getting something done even if it's just a chair massage. This time around they popped open a bottle of bubble champaign and made mimosas.

28.description: Since trying pearls nails, I have not been to another salon! I have actually brought a few friends here to enjoy the experience. The customer service is usually amazing most of the staff is super sweet and attentive. They have a good selection of colors, and the free drink is always a plus. Weekday specials for $35 ? Sold!

45.description: I have gotten a no chip at a number of salons. Kim at Pearl's nails is by far the best! The care you receive off the bat is great! How they take care of you throughout your time is top notch! I will recommend  them to friends for years. I hope I never move!

33.description: My wife and I are here right now. This place is GREAT!!! I just got a pedicure for the second time in my life and it was awesome! My wife is got a mani-pedi! The prices are very reasonable and they offered us a complimentary drink!! You cant go wrong coming here to Pearl's Nails. #ExcellentService #Timely #Professional #Quality

43.description: Unfortunately I know that walking into any nail shop on a friday they will probably be busy. I did walk in asking if there was any time for a manicure pedicure and was told 'no we are full' in a snobbish rude manner, I was not asked if I would  like to come in at a later time or maybe tomorrow so I walked out. obviously if my business was not wanted there is no reason for me to come back. I had been there before over a year ago and had a good experience but this shows that they really do not care to retain customers. Truly disappointed since my first experience was a good one.

2.description: Avoid this place.When you get a manicure, your nails should be even and smooth at the end. This manicure was essentially half finished.

18.description: This place is my absolute favorite! I was fortunate enough to find them when I first moved here and lived close by. I tried a couple other places closer by when I had to relocate and immediately went back to Pearl nails. They do a wonderful job and the staff is friendly. Cici is the best and does such a great job on the no-chip manicure. I highly recommend this place. FYI, make an appointment. Walk-in's usually have to wait awhile.

41.description: This place is glorious! The staff are very friendly, and the service is efficient and very, very well executed. I swear I've never had a no-chip look this perfect and the pedicure is to die for! They use hot stones and lotion to massage your legs and feet...it is pure bliss! I highly recommend Pearl's nails. It's definitely my new go-to salon!

52.description: I have been here several times over the passed year to get my eyebrows waxed before today I have had awesome service and kept coming back.  I will never ever come back here. My wax was awful today. Took 15 minutes which is a bit long for a nail salon. They usually ask my how I would like my brows and this time they didn't. So before she started on me I told her that I would just like a shape up and that I likes my arch. She basically had no idea what I was saying so I probably should have stopped there but that was my fault . She totally butchered one eye brow and took off too much hair. The other one she didn't take enough hair off. She also decided to ignore the fact that I said I likes my arch. When she showed me after she was finished I told her what was wrong and she fixed it. After the second time I didn't even want her to fix it again because I was nervous because she made it worse. The whole time it seemed like she had no idea what she was doing. I decided to go to benefit after so they could try and fix them and they told me I needed to let them just grow out. Also I showed "the cashier" my $1 off coupon and she told me I also get 10% off for being a student. She told me it would be $8.50. I handed them a $10 and she than said oh sorry I mean $9.. Very back and forth on their work and not stable. I would not recommend a wax from this place.

50.description: Loved this place! I was a walk-in and only had to wait about 10 minutes. Everyone is friendly and the place is very clean, which is a must for me. It's perfectly located close to my school too. I'll be back :)

4.description: I'm going to be all the way honest with you. The reason this place has so many good reviews is because they offer a discount when you do so. My girlfriend and I set up impromptu appointments for manis and pedis with them today at 3pm. We got there on time but weren't ween until about 3:20. Mira, a nail tech there, did apologize for us having to wait. We both say in the pedi booths, and while my polish is decent, my feet still have a lot of dry skin on them because they use those sponge sort of foot smothers in comparison to pumice or a metal type of skin slough-er. Otherwise decent job.Got a shellac no-chip and the color is beautiful and the paint job is okay. Maybe I'm picky about my nails, but I like the polish to cover my entire nail, including the clear polish. My nails were filed a bit uneven but overall not bad. While my nail job wasn't the best, I still tipped Mira we'll win

6.description: This is the friendliest nail salon I have been to! Have Essie and OPI nail polishes and have great deals if you sign up to be on their free rewards program!

22.description: I had a great polish change here. I was surprised by the time and attention that was paid to my feet for only a $12 service. Filing, cuticles, a hot towel and a paint job was all included. I'd come again!

15.description: They do a great no chip manicure that lasts longer than any other nail salon I have gotten a no chip at. Excellent customer service and a complimentary hand massage is my favorite part!

57.description: Main reason why they only get two stars is due to their lack of organization and communication. I had asked for a signature spa pedicure and somehow they forgot the signature part and gave me a regular pedicure instead, what a disappointment except my sister got the signature pedicure and it wasn't worth the extra $15! Don't do it, she finished before us even though we started same time and she paid more. Ha!I go to get my nails done to relax, all the employees were hectic and didn't even offer us a drink in the beginning. Our pedicures were interrupted multiple times.The guy at the front who checked us in and out was super nice though so that's the only main reason why they get two stars. The pedicure was okay for $30 but that's actually pretty expensive for just a regular pedicure.... Never coming back, way more places to go in the city that are actually good

20.description: Nice and clean place, ice cold diet cokes on tap, good magazine selections....and the promise of a discount for a positive yelp review. Hm, what's missing in that? The service here is good but my main thing is quality of the paint job is what I'm in for, and I don't think it's unreasonable to expect a no chip manicure to last more than 4 days, but that's about what you get here. Don't be fooled by the positive reviews, just ladies looking for a discount. Lots of other nail places in the area to check out with better service and quality results. Sorry Pearls but I think we're done!

36.description: Definetely recommend this place! I got a no chip manicure last Thursday at Mario Tricoci that didn't last a week... I went to repair a nail at Pearls before my honeymoon, and they didn't charge me even though I didn't get my original there. Reservations are a good idea!

14.description: This place is a joke! I was around the area with my bf and we decided to stop by this nail salon for my pedicure and eyebrow waxing. Before I start, I have to admit that one of the good things about this place is that they open on Sundays and I know not a lot of nail salons do. Anyway, I called beforehand for an appointment so I did not have to wait for long. I walked in and the lady directed me to the pedicure chair. First of all, I told her the massage chair was not operating correctly. Instead of trying to fix the situation, she brushed it off her shoulders and said it was probably broken. Second, she did not make the effort to cut my cuticles. The pedicure itself did not even last for 15 minutes. It felt like something I can do myself at home. After my pedicure, she told me to go this room for my eyebrows and then again, I was disappointed. The eyebrow waxing itself was a bigger joke than the pedicure. I told her I wanted a clean up for my eyebrows. She did five strips of waxing and DID NOT HELP ME SHAPE MY BROWS. She didn't tweeze the excess part of my brows. She didn't even help me trim it at all. Literally, 5 strips of waxing and told me I was done. I ended up trimming it and fixing it myself at home. I would've told her to fix it but that lady did not look like she knows what she was doing and I am not putting my eyebrows at risk and let her make it even worse than it already is. My boyfriend had a foot massage while he waits for me. He was not satisfied as well. The lady who massaged him did not put any strength/effort to his massage. He did not felt any pressure from her at all. I would not recommend this place to anyone. I was not impressed with my overall experience. It wasn't crazy expensive for my service but this place was super unprofessional and I can't believe I paid someone for a half-assed job. I am never coming back.

1.description: Besides the horrible attitudes, the service is tolerable. Almost all of the staff act as if they don't want to be there.  They rush you through your order in the drive thru. It doesn't matter if you know what you want exactly or taking a literal second to decide.  The only reason to come back is the fact that this is the only checkers within reasonable distance.

2.description: I sat in the drive thru for 20 minutes which was annoying since the drive thru is suppose to be express. The car in front of me was sitting joking with 2 window workers who I believe dished out free food and drinks! But anyway, I ordered a number 8 meal which is popcorn chicken breast. Once I got to the window the cashier handed me my food and I asked for BBQ sauce and she told me it's .50 per sauce. So I'm pissed that she never told me that when I first placed my order. What restaurant don't include sauces for meals that require them?! Chicken nuggets, popcorn chicken, and chicken rings always include at least one sauce at Wendy's, White Castle, Burger King, and  McDonald's BUT not  Checker's....And to top it off my fries were old!

0.description: I went there tonight and the woman at the drive thru was very friendly, and the service was quick. This location I was finally able to try the banana milkshake, every time I go to the one on 55th they never have their shake machine working.

3.description: We love Soul Vegan foods and are thrilled they are always on hand at our local Whole Foods in Hinsdale! We enjoy the BBQ, Jalapeno dip, mac and cheese and the steak wrap.

1.description: I haven't been able to eat at the restaurant but I have been eating the refrigerated meals for lent.  With that being said it is crazy yummy.   I was completely duped by the mac n cheese.  What I liked the most about it was that none of the flavor was lost but none of the cholesterol was there either!!!  I repeat NO CHOLESTEROL.  I wasn't a fan of tofu but i guess I was wrong and I am sooo glad I gave it a try.  I might order a tray of the mac n cheese for Easter Sunday.  I almost forgot I also tried the unchicken salad.  The texture was perfect and the flavor was great.

2.description: Obsessed! Amazing vegan food. I discovered it at Whole Foods and had them cater an event.  Very delicious! Great staff, too.  I can't wait to try all of their foods.  Their online catering menu looks amazing!  Highly recommended.

5.description: I never expected convenience food to taste this good nor did ever imagine I would write a review on food I picked up in the deli area of Whole Foods.  I was looking for a few quick , healthly lunches to have on hand and stumbled across their unreal chicken wrap.  I make a special trip to Whole Foods every week to stock up.  I echo the other reviews on the lasagna and Mac and cheese..to die for whether you are a vegan or not.  I can only imagine how good the food is in the restaurant.

6.description: I had to look up Soul Vegan on here after I finished the Jerk Chicken wrap I purchased at Whole Foods. It was absolutely delicious!! I'll be back to try the other wraps made by these people.

7.description: Thought I had died and gone to heaven when I tried the BBQ Delights - am following the Whole Food Plant based regimen to reverse heart disease-and the ingredients on package did not include any oil or fat.  However I noticed an oil residue on plate after I heated it in microwave so called Soulvegan and person I spoke to said that there was oil in it and was surprised that it was not included in list of ingredients. Said he will correct that  -- meanwhile I'm posting this warning. But for anyone else who does not have to worry about oils,fats, - it sure is finger lickin' good.

8.description: I don't care if you are vegan or not.  If you eat the lasagna and aren't in love with it, you are dead inside.  I absolutely love their lasagna and their BBQ ...    I would eat both of those dishes from soul vegan before anything.  It is literally the best fake meat lasagna you will ever have.  It might be the best lasagna you have ever had meat or not.. it makes it very easy to be vegan.

9.description: I get the Soul Vegan lunches where they are sold around locations in Hyde Park (Treasure Island, Open Produce, UChicago campus).  Their meals are extremely tasty and filling, so you will enjoy whether you are vegan or not.  My favorite it the BBQ tofu, greens, and mac and cheese.  Then mac and cheese is AMAZING.  I am a native southerner, so this is high praise from me.

0.description: This place is awesome. Love the food- it's very tasty and there are a variety of options on the menu. The way things are seasoned it tantalizing to your taste buds. I recommend the tofu jerk wrap- jerkfu wrap for lunch and the coconut cake. You will try it and be shocked it's veggie food! Totally delicious. Service is excellent and a gem in Chicago.

4.description: SOOOO AMAZING! The only way I will ever go to the Taste of Chicago and deal with the crowds is if this place is there! They have amazing comfort food! Their sauces are the best and the fake meat is delicious!

58.description: I love this place so much! It's further than any other nail place around me but they do such a good job and are so friendly I don't mind the longer travel time.I made the mistake of going to the one off the Brown line and it made me actually miss this place, ha!Highly recommended, especially if you're having one of those days, they'll make it all better :)

56.description: So I'd love to give this place a higher rating because I like the atmosphere and the lady working the front was very nice and accommodating. However, the no-chip manicure I got was horrible. I understand that I was there an hour before they closed and I do realize that people are tired and want to go home so even though I was annoyed at being rushed out of there, I SORT of...KIND of was understanding. Even though the girl doing my nails smeared lotion on my hands and then just wiped it off because she didn't feel like giving me an actual hand massage or rubbing the lotion in. All while checking her cellphone and giggling over text messages (such a pet peeve..so unprofessional). But when I got home and actually saw the bubbles and imperfection on my nails I was livid!!  I can't believe I spent $70 + tip for such a crappy mani/pedi on the ONE DAY where I got off of work early. Not to mention this was my birthday gift to myself. What a waste. I wish I had painted my own nails...

29.description: I was extremely impressed with this salon! Clean and inviting atmosphere, very organized, and they have someone managing appointments and the flow of people inside. There is someone at the front who will check you in, tell you an estimate wait time, and then seat you when you're ready. It's BYOB, so feel free to bring some champagne in for a girls day! They also ask if you'd like a water or drink right up seating you, very attentive! My pedicure turned out great, with warm lavender water, exfoliation and massage, and PROPER tools used when cleaning up the polish (versus when they take their finger and just wipe it off with their nail). The color selection is abundant, and at the end, they gave me a little shoulder massage! Definitely will be coming back and highly recommend!

42.description: Because I absolutely LOVED my experience here at My Nail.com last year, I decided to make another trip here when I went to visit my cousins in Illinois last month.Okay let me just say how memorable my experience was last year. My cousins live in the suburbs... meaning... they live about 40-45 minutes from the city. We could've easily driven about 5 minutes from my cousins' place to get our nails done, but I was adamant that we go to My Nail.com. My cousin was obviously annoyed. She couldn't fathom the idea that one would actually waste 40 extra minutes of time and gas to paint some nails when there was a perfectly decent nail salon a few minutes from her place.We were about 5-10 minutes late for our appts and the owner was so cool about it. She's seriously one of the friendliest business owners I've ever met. Even during really busy/peak hours, she was cool, calm, and collected.This place was as clean (if not cleaner) as my last visit here. We were offered drinks!The nail technician working on my nails asked me from time to time if I liked how my nails were coming out (very sweet).And the one working on my busted ass feet (poor thing) did everything she could to make me feel comfortable and not embarrassed about coming in with the most dreadful calloused feet anyone has ever seen.Okay skip to about an hour later after getting our mani/pedi...My cousin apologized to me for giving me an attitude earlier.I made her drive 40 extra minutes and she actually apologized to me. Does this sort of maybe paint a picture in your head about how great this place is?

23.description: Service is good! The host is very welcoming and your nail service comes with a free drink :) my nail specialist got the no chip done pretty quickly and well. Paid about $40 for no chip, including tax and tip. I had to come back here to get them removed. The price is $5 no matter you got your nails done here or not.

47.description: I got a pedicure. Thought it was just fine. Unlike some of the other posts, they used a pumice stone and all that good stuff for my pedicure. Planning on going back

8.description: Ever have an experience at a local business and believe Ashton K. was going to come out of a corner with a ton of cameras because the only logical explanation for the bizarre experience you're having is that you're being Punk'd? Well, I did. A MUST READ!! So ladies, if you workout hard, run, and/or perform strenuous athletic activities like I do, you know you're going to end up with ingrown nails, calluses, and corns from time-to-time. When I walked in, I told the check-in attended I was there for my appointment. I told her I had a really painful ingrown nail that would need to be removed asap by someone who knows how to do so. She guided me to a woman named "So-Pee", not really  sure how it's spelled but it's like Sophie without the "fee" sound. Anyways, my appointment was for a Mani/Pedi. I was taken to the pedicure chair first which seemed dirty and unhygienic. Gross. The water she prepared for me was lukewarm, not even a sliver of comforting hot, bubbling water to make you feel relaxed, in fact...no bubbles @ all. The pedicure was done in a blink of an eye. She was so eager to get done and in such a rush that it literally took 20 minutes from start to finish; I timed it. I told SoPee as well about my ingrown. She merely picked at it a bit with her device and said that was that. I asked, "are you sure it's gone?" She said "oh yeah!" And rolled her eyes at me with a huge attitude!! Wtf??  She then "scrubbed" my feet with a pumice stone for a total of 20 second on each foot. Please, people, look @ my pics. She didn't do a thing, no dead skin was removed, nothing. It was like she was rubbing my feet for  second with a rock instead of actually scrubbing. My 10 year old cousin could do better than SoPee. After I was done, I was taken over to the manicure chair. The little tray with rocks was so dirty that the water was a weird, cloudy color. The manicure took 15 minutes, and just like the pedicure, was done so poorly and with zero efforts. I had brought my OWN POLISH and she refused to paint all the way back to the cuticle (salons do this so that you could go back sooner). I asked her to do that and she refused, still. My nails looked like they were painted by a child, no joke. At the end of it all, I just wanted to GTFO of there ASAP. I was drying my nails when the owner came up to me and asked me how I heard about them. I told her it was through a Yelp Elite event I attended where they were giving out gift certificates so I wanted to take advantage and try them out in-store. After telling her that...the owner, not once, asked me how my services were. If she had, I would've gladly had diarrhea of the mouth and told her what a lousy nail tech she has on her staff. Even though my pedicure was discounted, I wouldn't go back to this place even if it was free! I came home and had to scrub my own feet and take out the ingrown nail myself. My favorite part of my   mynail.com experience was when I opened that door and left that establishment. Ashton K., I still have faith you were hiding in there somewhere for that hour I was succumbed to this place. Awful, just awful.

31.description: Ever have an experience at a local business and believe Ashton K. was going to come out of a corner with a ton of cameras because the only logical explanation for the bizarre experience you're having is that you're being Punk'd? My favorite part of my   mynail.com experience was when I opened that door and left that establishment. Ashton K., I still have faith you were hiding in there somewhere for that hour I was succumbed to this place. Awful, just awful.

34.description: I made an appointment for a mani pedi on Valentine's Day and had a great experience. Everyone was so friendly, helpful, and professional. When I entered they offered me a drink, and we're extra accommodating as I had a cut on my ankle from earlier in the day and they got me fresh band aids after the pedi was done. Both the pedicure and shellac manicure were excellent, and they really took the time to do their best even though the salon was very busy for the holiday. I would certainly go back!Edited to add: My no-chip manicure chipped within a week of going, so I called and they were able to fit me in to get it fixed. It was very nice of them and again they made sure to take their time doing a good job on the nail repair. Just one more reason I will use them again!

16.description: Excellent service and attention to detail.  We walked in with a group of 6 girls and everyone was taken care of promptly, but none of the technicians were rushing either.  We all were very happy with our manicures!The salon is very clean and well maintained and all of the techs are well dressed and have clean hands and nice nails too.  At some salons the nail techs hands are horrific.  Not the case here!I'm from out of town, but if I lived here I would make this my regular nail salon for sure.

13.description: This nail salon had availability for 4 girls on short notice on a rainy Saturday, so we went with it.  We all opted for a regular manicure, which cost $15.  The ladies were all very nice, and efficient.  They have a large nail color selection which is always a plus.  I really enjoyed that they offered various beverages, AND you have the option of BYOB.  My favorite part of the nail appointment, was after we went to dry our nails, I was given a small shoulder rub.  I just wish that part lasted longer!

11.description: Probably my new favorite nail salon in the city. Called on a Sunday morning to see what they had available for appointments and had my pick of times. Was almost 10 minutes late but they got me in no problem and I didn't get any attitude for stink-eye for being late.This place is super clean and super cutely decorated. It seems like sometimes salons have little gnats flying around, or you feel like the tools are dirty, not this place. Never saw anything gross or smelled anything gross.The polish selection is great too, and super organized, which I appreciate.Got a regular pedicure (only problem here was I didn't feel like I get enough of a massage, will ask for more next time) and a regular manicure and had the same girl for each, was super quiet but sweet, really allows you to relax.Will be a regular from here on out!

39.description: It was my daughters birthday and I had been doing some research on a good nail salon in the area to get a gift certificate for mani/pedi for a birthday gift.I contacted Susie at My Nail.com. She was so nice and left me with such a good impression that I ordered the no chip mani and pedi gift card, which she sent to me since I was not able to pick it up. My daughter went and the services were very good. The only thing was the little extra that Susie promised me to make my daughter's birthday gift a little more special.When I called to mention this to Susie, she apologized profusely and rectified the situation on the spot. She really cares that your experience at the salon is a wonderful one. I was very impressed, as was my daughter with the next visit.Thank you Susie, for making my daughter feel special and the superb mani/pedi.We will most definitely continue to use the services as well as recommend this salon to friends and family.Thanks so much!

37.description: I made an appointment this morning after seeing all the rave reviews and noticing that it was right around the corner from my hotel.   It took twenty five minutes before I was worked on because of a bridal party. Knowing of the party coming in at open, I wish they would've given me a more realistic appointment time. But I stayed. Less than three hours later and I had chipped nails. And no, I did not take a pottery class or wash dishes with a Brillo pad after. Even with a five dollar off certificate for a future service, it just doesn't make sense to give this place another shot.

0.description: Oh my gosh, oh my gosh, oh my gosh you guys!! Ok be prepared because I'm about to gush about this place because I just had the best no chip ever. The staff is so accommodating and sweet! Talk about amazing customer service. You get offered a beverage when you check in and they move your purse/other odds & ends around for you if you need to change stations. And the purse hooks...they have purse hooks at each station! Genius. I can't believe that after all of the other times that I've splurged on my nails, this is the first joint to have purse hooks so that I don't have to put my purse on the floor (I'm superstitious, ask around & someone will let you in on the urban legend)! Oooo yeah & don't even get me started on the massage capabilities of this staff = killer! The atmosphere is amazing & I haven't even mentioned the quality of my no chip *speechless head shake* stunning! My final word: make sure you pop in here & treat yourself. We all have to take time out of our busy schedules & have a minute for ourselves. I know the next time that I feel the need for a "Me" day, I'll be making a b-line to Mynail.com! Tip: hit this place up on Wednesday for a pretty righteous no chip special. Hell, they even have a no chip quality guarantee if you sign up for their free membership card!

38.description: I've never been here before but was walking by, looked at my hands, and realized I needed it bad.  What a great decision!  They got me in immediately for a manicure.  My technician, Anna, not only did a wonderful job on my nails and cuticles, but gave me an amazing arm and hand massage with two kinds of oils and a lotion.  She didn't care for my choice of nail polish brand and suggested another. I went with her recommendation and am so glad I did.    As I was sitting there, someone came around who was handing out cozy holiday socks as a gift to all their customers today.  Crazy!  I can't say enough good things about my experience here.  Even though it's out of my way a bit, I will be making it my regular nail spot from here on out.

51.description: My first time getting a pedicure ever, and it was great! They did a great job and were so nice! They also gave me a shoulder massage while my toes were drying! I'm definitely going back there.

27.description: I received a gift certificate for a mani pedi here and was one of the best I've had. They have a great polish selection and had all the newest collections. I didn't have an appointment and was serviced right away even though it was a Saturday at noon. They offered a beverage which was really nice. They are very attentive and care about their customers. Highly recommend!

32.description: 3.5 stars....but...whatevs.So I used my trusty booking site PrettyQuick (check out my blog link for $$$ off) for a no chip mani and regular pedi heren because I was in the area running errands and its super easy to book online and on the go!  BONUS!!The guy at the front is SUPA customer service man.  I dont know why, I really liked him.  Seemed to really get it...I just wished I had a better nail experience.The staff...well, they were OK.  The pedi was pretty average.  The no chip mani was ok as well.  I wish she would have done a better job with the shaping and cleaning up my nails.  Needless to say, the offer free fixes of the no chip if its within a week.  Three of my nails chipped.  I went back today to get it fixed and two of the three have already chipped...7 hours after getting them fixed.  She did a poor job putting the polish back on and while its a nice concept...I just dont think its great to get a few nails polished.  Who has the time...basically I wasted the 45 mins at this place to get my nails repainted just to have them chip again today.  Bah

54.description: I don't live near this salon but I won't go anywhere else for my nails now. They are just so consistently excellent and as an added bonus, the service and experience they provide while you are there is always lovely. It is a always a real treat for me to get my nails done here.

48.description: This place is by far the best place to get your nails done in the city. I have lived all over the city so I have had my fair share of nail salons but this place takes ultimate top spot. The location is so convenient and it is super clean inside. The nail techs do a FANTASTIC job and will fix your nails if they chip within a week. Whenever I go in there, the owner is there and she is so friendly and accommodating. I've gabbed to all of my girlfriends and now they come here to get their nails done.Definitely call ahead but they can usually get you in fairly soon.

44.description: I recently had a spa pedi and regular mani here.  I was so looking forward to my service based on the many positive reviews I read here on Yelp and also on the nail salon's overall rating.  I really wanted to like this place but I was actually very disappointed with my service.  My overall spa pedicure experience , in general, was very rushed and lacked attention to detail.  I was in and out of the water in 15 minutes.  My toenails were carelessly filed so that I had to request they be refiled.  The work done on my cuticles also left much to be desired.  There was absolutely no work done on the calloused areas of my feet, even though I specifically requested a special callous treatment.  In fact, when I made an appointment I was told they treated callouses.  I really didn't feel pampered or like I had received a "spa" treatment.  Besides, I was busy coaching the nail tech through the pedicure process so I couldn't really relax.  The pedicure I received was one I could have done at home on myself!  This kind of pedicure might work well for the person who's feet are nearly perfect and don't require much work.  People, like me, who need more work done on their feet might do well to find another salon for a pedicure.  As for my manicure, it was just okay, but definitely better than the pedicure.  Although my nails looked nice for 3 days, it took only 2 days before my cuticles started to peel badly and look worse than they did before I had the manicure.  That was disappointing.  I selected one of the organic polishes, one of the ones with a $3 up charge, and it took forever to dry in the salon.  That was a mistake.  I will say that the owner was very friendly and quite accommodating.  The selection of colors was up to date and vast.  I thought the complimentary drinks were a nice touch.  However, I will probably not waste my time giving this place a second chance.

24.description: First time going: was fantastic. I made an online appointment and when arrived was promptly seated with a beverage of my choice. I'm not sure what the women's name was that I had but she was excellent.I had the spa mani and pedi. Great clean environment. Wonderful job on both; I highly recommend the spa pedicure if you only do one.Great bath salts and lotions; you get the parrafin wax with it too and great selection of opi and Essie polishes. Very relaxing. I thoroughly enjoyed myself and would go back.I didn't feel rushed at all, looks like a great place to go with someone as well, and the massages on my legs, hands, feet, arms, and the shoulder massage while drying (quick) were so well done, felt great.

7.description: Monday winter special no chip mani and reg pedi for $60: Holy wow, batman! The pedi massage was amazing by Pearl!!! I think my eyes actually rolled back into my head. The hot towels and sugar scrub was also great but her technique is well seasoned. The nochip mani was also very good and fast! I can't believe they use real vitamin e pills to massage the hands. Also some delicious smelling spray that seems to sanitize and hydrate or prep the nails.I have worked in nail salons for years and am thoroughly impressed. They even have the latest collections by OPI.  Will be back for Pearl!

49.description: After 3 years of living in Chicago I finally found the a nail salon I will return to. It's clean, affordable, and they do an excellent job. As soon as I walked in I was greeted and had my pick of almost all colors Essie offers and many OPI polishes as well. I was seated almost immediately in a comfy massage chair and was offered a beverage of my choice. Auggie gave me the best pedicure I've had since moving here. She was very thorough at trimming my cuticles and removing dry/dead skin. The massage was excellent and the hot towel wrapped around my calves at the end was the icing on the cake.I'll definitely be a repeat customer.

40.description: I love this place and am so happy to live nearby. I have been quite a few times (probably around 15 thus far), and have never had a bad experience. The no-chip manicures are wonderful -- I have had one last three weeks, and even then the polish was still in great condition, I just needed to have them redone since they were growing out! The fact that the salon is never empty should be a testament to how good it is; people love coming here. Staff is always friendly and accommodating, offering a drink when you walk in and taking your coat. The rewards card is also awesome, I have gotten $10 off my no-chip manicures a few times. If you haven't yet, you should definitely check it out!

53.description: Everyone was very nice here.  You can tell they work hard to keep their salon clean and modern.  The head gal was going and changing out the water on every fresh flower vase and basically was going around making sure everything was in place.  The pedicure was not rushed and very detailed.  My french manicure was done great and lasted.  Im certainly going back!

30.description: Came here a couple of months ago to get a no-chip manicure for a vacation and was left strongly disappointed and felt cheated. The young man was the one who did my nails and was so distracted by his iphone that he seemed unable to focus on doing his job and instead texted throughout. I asked to get white done and when I left I could still see my nails underneath. The color and thickness was so uneven and bubbly in areas and thin in others. Luckily I kept my receipt and they honored the deal that if it chips within a week they'll fix it because it chipped in two places within two days. A different lady fixed the problem nails but i'm still unhappy and never going to return.

46.description: This salon is fabulous. The staff is friendly and their work is meticulous. With a complementary beverage, candy, and massage you can have a relaxing experience. The no chip lasts for two full weeks as well.

1.description: UPDATE:In the two weeks since I've been here, I've noticed a couple things I'm notnthrilled about, so I wanted to do an update. I've noticed my hands have had quite a few hangnails. And my a few, I mean 8. My cuticles are pretty snagged up, and the peeling of my nails is bad. On top of that, the heels of my feet are disgusting. I don't expect my feel to be baby smooth two weeks after a pedicure, but I had noticed they weren't too smooth within hours of my service, and they've gotten so much worse since. I was literally scrapping them in the shower to try and remove some of it. I've had a few mani pedis, but I've never had this problem before. Is it the weather? Maybe. I'll possibly try them again and see what happens. ORIGINAL REVIEW:Iwent in for a Mani pedi. Nice little birthday gift to myself, and it was a nice way to spend the credits I had on Whittl. The man at the front was super nice. Took my coat, and offered me tea. My nail tech wasn't that pleasant. No hello or anything, just went right to work. I'm not one for small talk so it didn't bother me that much, but at least a greeting and a smile or something would have been nice. She kept looking around while doing my nails, like I was wasting her time or something. But for the actual nails, she did a good job. After not doing much of anything to my nails for a couple months, they were in some rough shape. Now they're smooth and I'm loving the polish. I liked the mini massage at the drying station, and the older lady that helped me into my shoes and coat was nice. I also liked that they put a little bag over my feet so that my shoes didn't wreck my polish. The only issue was that my feet became sooo itchy during my 2 minute walk home. It subsided after a few minutes but it was awful during that short time. All in all, I did like the place. More so than another nail shop I went to a little south on Clark. I booked my appointment, paid and tipped all online so that wasn't a hassle. The place didn't reek of chemicals. I got a pretty nice mani pedi for a decent price. If you're not looking for an exceptionally attentive high class spa experience, this is a good place to go. And if you haven't tried Whittl to book and pay for appointments online, you should! Signing up gives you a nice little discount, too. whittl.com/invitation/B5…

55.description: I'm moving close to this place soon and have a feeling I'll be coming back...many times.The service was impeccable. I was kind of in a rush, but they got another technician to do my mani while I was at the pedi massage chairs.The owner was fussing over me with quick-dry drops, and they practically dressed me so I wouldn't smudge my nails. My mom also commented on how great $40 was for a mani/pedi combo. (Side note: my mom is frugal, so this is saying something.)A free drink, candy, and attentive, meticulous technicians makes this my new fave place.

9.description: 3.5 stars....but...whatevs.So I used my trusty booking site PrettyQuick (check out my blog link for $$$ off) for a no chip mani and regular pedi heren because I was in the area running errands and its super easy to book online and on the go!  BONUS!!The guy at the front is SUPA customer service man.  I dont know why, I really liked him.  Seemed to really get it...I just wished I had a better nail experience.The staff...well, they were OK.  The pedi was pretty average.  The no chip mani was ok as well.  I wish she would have done a better job with the shaping and cleaning up my nails.  Needless to say, the offer free fixes of the no chip if its within a week.  Three of my nails chipped.  I went back today to get it fixed and two of the three have already chipped...7 hours after getting them fixed.  She did a poor job putting the polish back on and while its a nice concept...I just dont think its great to get a few nails polished.  Who has the time...basically I wasted the 45 mins at this place to get my nails repainted just to have them chip again today.  Bah

26.description: I was originally going to a nail salon on Broadway, but having moved a little further north, it was time to change it up. As most gals know, this is terrifying. Finding a nail salon is almost like finding a hair salon. One wrong move and you are no longer a customer. So, after reading the reviews on Yelp, I decided to give this place a try.My best friend and I walked in and we were instantly greeted. We gave our names as we had made appointments and they told us they were ready to take us back for our pedicures. Their color selection is HUGE! I have not been to another salon with such an expansive array of colors and polish brands. After selecting our colors, we went back and got seated, drinks were brought to us, and we got to relax. The only negative I could think about the pedicure is that the massage chairs were acting funny. It kept stopping every 30 seconds, which made me more anxious than relaxed. Aside from that, the pedicure was great. JoJo took her time, and my toes looked great. The only criticism is that she filed my nails a bit too short, but like all things, they will grow. JoJo also did my nails. They were great. She listened to what I wanted, and executed exactly what asked. She also took her time, so I never felt like she was in a hurry.All in all, this place was great. They have a rewards program, but I'm not really sure what it is. I did get a card where they printed my visit information on there. I will have to ask next time.If you are looking for a great place in lakeview, definitely check this place out. I would recommend making an appointment, as walk-ins did have to walk about 15-20 minutes. However, it was also Memorial Weekend, so that could have something to do with it.Mani-Pedi was $40.

25.description: It was alright. I'm giving it 4 stars because the service was great, butthe atmosphere is lacking. Chairs are on top of each other and the decor is just sad. I just felt crowded.

12.description: Where do I begin with mynail.com... Let's start with Suzy, the sweet and adorable owner of this salon. She is as sweet as she is fashionable, always greeting me with a smile and waiting on me hand and foot. She's a huge reason I keep coming back.The service is always impeccable. I usually come in for no chip manicures, and every single technician I've worked with has been efficient without sacrificing quality! One time, I also had nail art done for a special occasion. The tech who did it had all sorts of fun and pretty stickers and wands to bring a little extra pizazz to your hands!In short, if you're looking for a little me time, go to this salon! You'll come out feeling refreshed, and your hands/feet will thank you for taking the time to go!!!

59.description: My goodness, this place is the worst. I don't understand all the positive reviews; it's possible that they are from people who know the owner(s).
